intro: Sideroxylon maluense, commonly known as the African ironwood tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dense, hard wood that is highly valued for its durability. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and can reach heights of up to 20 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating, while its flowers are small and clustered in greenish-yellow inflorescences. Sideroxylon maluense plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
